main event: Seven objects were observed in a stationary formation in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on September 15, 1965.
interesting points: The objects were thought to be reflections of the sun through clouds., They lasted for approximately 5-10 minutes before disappearing., The color of the objects appeared to be pale, similar to a full moon., The objects were perfectly round circles with no trails or sound., The height of the clouds at the time of observation was around 15,000 feet.
sighted object: seven stationary objects in the sky
